import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
source.01389a50:
fig, ax = plt.subplots()

sns.kdeplot(train[train["Recommended"]==1]["Age"], shade=True, color="blue", label="Recommended", ax=ax)
sns.kdeplot(train[train["Recommended"]==0]["Age"], shade=True, color="red", label="Not Recommended", ax=ax)

ax.set_xlabel("Age")
ax.set_ylabel("Density")
ax.legend()

fig.suptitle("Age vs. Recommendation");
source.3a0c6a28:
fig, ax = plt.subplots()

sns.kdeplot(train[train["Recommended"]==1]["Pos_Feedback_Cnt"], shade=True, color="blue", label="Recommended", ax=ax)
sns.kdeplot(train[train["Recommended"]==0]["Pos_Feedback_Cnt"], shade=True, color="red", label="Not Recommended", ax=ax)

ax.set_xlabel("Positive Feedback Count")
ax.set_ylabel("Density")
ax.legend()

fig.suptitle("Positive Feedback Count vs. Recommendation");
source.bc7c8fdf:
df_numeric = train[['Age','Pos_Feedback_Cnt']]
l = df_numeric.columns.values
number_of_columns=11
number_of_rows = len(l)-1/number_of_columns
plt.figure(figsize=(4*number_of_columns,10*number_of_rows))
for i in range(0,len(l)):
    plt.subplot(number_of_rows + 1,number_of_columns,i+1)
    sns.distplot(df_numeric[l[i]],kde=True)
source.851000c7:
plt.figure(figsize=(4*number_of_columns,10*number_of_rows))
for i in range(0,len(l)):
    plt.subplot(number_of_rows + 1,number_of_columns,i+1)
    sns.violinplot(df_numeric[l[i]],kde=True)
source.6eb9a733: Ratings and Recommendations are mainly positive.
source.a0e1efbe: No strong correlation between any of the independent and dependent variables. Rating and Recommended have somewhat strong correlation as was expected
source.5abb34f2: We have two target variables - Rating and Recommended
source.7e64c7a5: 503 feedbacks don't contain review and 2359 misses titles for reviews. We can remove the Title column completely as it has many missing values
source.eedb0450: Both Age and Pos_Feedback_Cnt are right skewed
source.02d5b78c: Most of the clothes were rated 5 followed by 4
